content.description:
Marceline, she is pretty and mean, the vampire queen.

This route is one of the best climbs at Wolverine, and well worth the extra 5 minutes of hiking past the Bud wall. The crux of the route is moving through the dishes in the bottom half, and the top half is just mind blowingly good stone.
content.location:
This route is at a new wall we have dubbed the tree house. To get there go uphill past the bud wall about 20 feet and traverse across to the low point of the saddle to the right(north). Basically just hike up and over the saddle. The tree house is located on a large triangular face with trees around the base.

If you find bolts on the rock, you are there. As of summer 2014 the Tree house is the only wall north of the Bud Wall/over the saddle. Marceline starts at a broken off stump in the cluster of trees.

content.description: BMO is the middle of the 3 routes on the Tree House wall. The lower 4-5 bolts are where they are to keep you from making friends with the tree in the event of a fall, but that's not necessarily where all the holds are.

Another fine example of the giant chert formations found at wolverine. Sustained technical climbing from start to finish. Possibly the coolest feature of the route is also the crux, a huge round plate of bulletproof, featureless stone that sticks out just enough to climb around the perimeter.

Bolted a little more comfortably than the average route at Wolverine. I'd recommend belaying close to the wall and to the right of the climb to avoid any pebbles, the route trends left higher up.
content.location: Starts at the bottom of the BIG crack.
